TopicTitle: You must use the object that is in your left hand to survive a thermonuclear war

Articles.Content: The ground... *Pulls out shovel* It\'s bunker-diggin\' time!
I was scratching my ear. Ouucch? Hmm, sounds like a plan. Geddit? Amiright? Right? Eh? No? erm...

HAHA! This time I was wearing full pants!

Oh wait...

My middle toenail...

I Don't know how that is going to help me survive a thermonuclear war.
umm a lamp. Lamp can be used as a melee weapon for protection against bandits.

A raw steak.

Assuming I get to also use the barbecue on my right, at least I'd die happy.

My head.

I must think to survive the war.
A book on Flight manoeuvres called Air Combat Manoeuvres. It's fairly thick and heavy, but I'm not burning it! I need something to read.
My earphones, connected to my ipod, so at least I can listen to some awesome songs while I'm dying.

A cereal bowl and a spoon...

*beats self over the head repetitively*
A piano. At least I can play music while I am killed by radiation.
A cup of tea. I can always take the typically british view of "sit down, have a cup of tea, and wait for all this to blow over"
Nothing, I'm screwed
A wall...well, good bye.
A lunchbox- I can eat as I die.
My grandmother...
My backpack. Contents include: fresh water, snacks, sharp objects, paper and pencil (to stay sane) and more! I'm all set.

A chair and a pen.

GAHHHHH!

Seriously?!

Seriously, A bottle of Morning Fresh GermX!!!

Well, at least I won't get sick and die like the rest of you.
A wall and keyboard... I won't survive long
Paper and pencil.
A half eaten Tim-Tam... I'm boned, the radiation is seeping int- *pop* Now I have 3 heads O.o
My jeans. Well looks like I'm doomed.

My backpack. Again. With extra electronics.

I win.

A skirt.

WELLLLLLP
